articles.title: Qld woman's death treated as suspicious
articles.text:
Qld woman's death treated as suspiciousStaff WritersAAPFri, 8 April 2022 11:58AM
The death of a woman in the driveway of a Cairns unit is being treated as suspicious, as a man known to her is questioned by police.
Investigators believe the man alerted emergency services at about 5am on Friday morning before the 47-year-old woman was found unconscious in the suburb of Manunda.
She died at the scene at about 6.20am.
Police are looking at whether domestic violence played a role, but Detective Inspe ...

articles.title: Forget the sexy leads, Good Behaviour is all about location, location, location
articles.text:
Women who aren't who they say they are: the dish of the day of TV dramas of late. Think Inventing Anna, The Dropout, Pieces of Her and the new Underbelly series. All stories about women pulling a swifty, even if they think they are doing the right thing. Good Behaviour is a few years old, originally screening in 2016 and 2017 (and previously on subscription streaming), but it tracks along the same lines: a woman pretending to be someone she is not.
Michelle Dockery, aka Downton Abbey's Lady Mary ...

articles.title: 'Chastened' Liberal candidate Katherine Deves breaks silence, pledges nuanced debate
articles.text:
Federal Liberal candidate Katherine Deves says her family has left Sydney due to death threats received following her comments about transgender people.
Deves, who opposes inclusion of trans women in women's sport, broke her silence in an interview with SBS News on Sunday night where she detailed alleged death threats.
"I have had to have the police and the [Australian Federal Police] involved," she said. "My safety has been threatened. My family are away out of Sydney because I don't want them  ...

articles.title: IT sector reveals nation's top innovators
articles.text:
"There's just a lot of power behind that model, and so we're just trying to unlock that for the things that really matter," Ross says.
ICT Professional of the Year, Mahendra Samarawickrama, also wants to unlock the power of technology but importantly, ensure it works for all of us at the same time.
According to Samarawickrama, the first industrial revolution delivered benefits unimaginable to humanity at the time but it also unleashed climate change on the planet, so his goal is to hopefully ens ...

articles.title: Rental homes slim picking for low earners
articles.text:
Rental homes slim picking for low earnersPhoebe LoomesAAPThu, 28 April 2022 1:39AM
Some 98 per cent of rental properties across the country are too expensive for workers on the minimum wage.
A new survey by Anglicare Australia of 45,992 rental listings shows the market is less affordable than ever, and all political parties need to act urgently.
Only 712 of the rental properties surveyed by Anglicare Australia, or two per cent, could be afforded by Australians earning minimum wage.
"Australia's  ...

articles.title: 'Nasty': New Vic housing tax blasted
articles.text:
A controversial plan that would slug homeowners potentially tens of thousands of dollars then funnel the cash into social housing is in doubt.
Victorian Treasurer Tim Pallas has touted the social housing tax bill as a plan that would save lives and create jobs.
Under the plan, all newly built developments with three or more dwellings or lot subdivisions would hand over 1.75 per cent of the expected project value, with the cash used to fund an extra 1700 social and affordable homes each year.
The ...

articles.title: Pollies urged to mind the skills gap
articles.text:
Pollies urged to mind the skills gapMarion RaeAAPWed, 20 April 2022 10:07PM
Skills shortages are top of mind for business owners who vote as Australia's jobless rate eyes fresh lows and vacancies go unfilled.
Closed borders have added to the skills gaps that Australia faced before the pandemic, and pledges of job creation are ringing hollow across the campaign trail for many.
The latest Australian Institute of Company Directors (AICD) sentiment index released on Thursday shows labour shortages a ...

articles.title: 'Senseless violence': Pensioner found dead
articles.text:
'Senseless violence': Pensioner found dead in Gold Coast houseDaniela PizziraniNCA NewsWireMon, 21 March 2022 8:06AM
Queensland police have established a crime scene after an elderly woman was found dead in a house on the Gold Coast.
Police were called to the Molendinar property, located north of the Gold Coast, around 8.40pm on Sunday night.
They discovered the body of a 74-year-old pensioner with significant injuries.
A 50-year-old man, who is known to the woman, is assisting police with their ...

articles.title: Monday start for winter booster rollout
articles.text:
While more than 30 per cent of Australians eligible to have their third COVID-19 shot are yet to, the elderly and vulnerable will begin receiving a second booster ahead of a predicted winter infection surge from Monday.
The groups will include those 65 or older, Indigenous Australians aged at least 50, disability care residents and the immunocompromised.
An estimated 4.7 million people will be eligible to get the fourth dose but its expected less than 200,000 will be able at the start of the rol ...

articles.title: COVID-19 outbreak blamed on non-compliance stretches APY Lands services
articles.text:
Health and community services on the APY Lands are stretched to the limit as a COVID-19 outbreak grows to 84 cases because of non-compliance with restrictions, its general manager claims.
Richard King said around 255 people were in isolation on the Lands while a smaller group with comorbidities was isolating closer to specialist services.
Mr King attributed the outbreak and community transmission to a minority of people who were not complying with restrictions.
"Like everywhere, we have a number ...

articles.title: Albo blasts PM over trans sport ban
articles.text:
Anthony Albanese criticises Scott Morrison for backing ban on trans women in female sportsCatie McLeodNCA NewsWireTue, 12 April 2022 6:39PM
Anthony Albanese has said Scott Morrison should focus on "doing his job" after the Prime Minister willingly waded into the culture wars on the first day of the 2022 election campaign.
During an interview blitz on Monday, the Prime Minister warned the education curriculum risked being "sold out to a left-wing agenda" and backed campaigns by two conservative f ...

articles.title: Good Friday campaign detente for leaders
articles.text:
Leaders have entered into a campaigning detente for Good Friday but are expected to be on the road again for Easter Saturday.
Prime Minister Scott Morrison and Labor leader Anthony Albanese are due to attend church services, with limited official campaign events to take place.
The leaders are expected to then rejoin the hustings on Saturday before breaking again for Easter Sunday.
Mr Morrison and Mr Albanese have also confirmed they will go head-to-head on Wednesday in their first debate of the  ...

articles.title: HCL pays high school grads to tackle tech skills shortage
articles.text:
HCL will also cover $5000 a year of university costs for those who want to attain a formal degree, such as a Bachelor of Information Technology, while they're working.
Mike Horton, the Perth-based head of HCL Technologies Australia, said just one person out of the 102 dropped out of the program, and the company hoped to create 5000 jobs in coming years, including 1125 this year.
"If we're going to solve this shortage of IT people, we've got to be doing programs like this," he said.
"We can't rel ...

articles.title: Australia needs another 280k skilled workers by 2025
articles.text:
Preeti Bajaj, chief executive of Adecco Group's Australian business, urged Australian policymakers and companies to think of skills training as an investment that would deliver a return.
That would enable investors to fund reskilling, in return for a tax offsets, which would ultimately be funded via higher wages that governments will tax.
"I encourage every CEO and every chief human resources officer in our country to think about this," Ms Bajaj said.
Having experienced skilled migration firstha ...

articles.title: Low deposit scheme expanded, but first-home buyers risk more pain than gain
articles.text:
The Morrison government has significantly expanded the low deposit scheme in the federal budget - a program under which first-home buyers and others can buy new or existing dwellings with a deposit of only 5 per cent (or 2.5 per cent for single parents).
But if the forecasts of falling house prices turn out to be correct, first-home buyers who put down a small deposit could soon find themselves in "negative equity", where the mortgage is larger than the market value of their dwelling.
Under the  ...

articles.title: PM backs push to kick trans girls out of sport
articles.text:
Scott Morrison backs 'terrific' proposal to kick transgender females out of single-sex sportsCourtney GouldNCA NewsWireTue, 22 February 2022 12:39PM
Prime Minister Scott Morrison has backed a push to exclude transgender girls and women from competing in female sports.
The proposal, introduced to federal parliament earlier this month by Tasmanian senator Claire Chandler, would amend the Sex Discrimination Act so it would not be unlawful to ban someone from a female sporting team based on their bi ...

articles.title: PM defends 'captain's pick' in Warringah
articles.text:
PM defends 'captain's pick' in WarringahMaeve BannisterAAPSat, 16 April 2022 10:11AM
Prime Minister Scott Morrison has defended a candidate he personally chose for the Sydney seat of Warringah despite Liberal party members calling for her to be disendorsed.
Katherine Deves has come under fire this week after her previous comments emerged whereby she mocked fears inside the trans community of suicide due to discrimination, called trans children "mutilated" and compared her resistance to trans ath ...

articles.title: Would you co-buy with the government if it meant you could own a house?
articles.text:
The federal government could help more Australians into the property market by co-purchasing homes with lower-income earners, a leading think tank has proposed as the nation's housing crisis pushes the dream of homeownership further out of reach for many.
A national shared equity scheme, where the federal government co-purchases up to 30 per cent of a property's value, is being called for by the Grattan Institute ahead of the next election as a way to help arrest declining rates of homeownership ...

articles.title: Shot that killed Kumanjayi 'not necessary'
articles.text:
Shot that killed Kumanjayi 'not necessary'Aaron BunchAAPWed, 2 March 2022 12:35AM
A murder-accused policeman's fatal second shot into an Aboriginal teenager was not reasonable or necessary, an expert witness has told a jury.
Detective Senior Sergeant Andrew Barram says Kumanjayi Walker, 19, was pinned down by another police officer and the scissors in his hand were a "very low threat".
Constable Zachary Rolfe, 30, has pleaded not guilty to murdering Mr Walker after the teen stabbed him in the sh ...

articles.title: Male power and abuse under the spotlight in provocative new works
articles.text:
Justine Clarke's brilliant embodiment of joy and grief in UK playwright Dennis Kelly's one-woman play Girls & Boys also takes on male power, in a finely calibrated production directed by Mitchell Butel.
Clarke, occupying the stage for 90 minutes without a break, plays an unnamed working-class woman. She begins by regaling us with comic tales from her character's early 20s of bad sex and bad substances, engaging the audience with much eye contact. Ambition dawns on this woman, held down by limite ...

articles.title: Sermanni named WSW women's football boss
articles.text:
Sermanni named WSW women's football bossAnna HarringtonAAPFri, 25 March 2022 2:59PM
Former Matildas, USA and New Zealand coach Tom Sermanni has been tasked with overhauling Western Sydney's women's football program as the Wanderers' first head of women's football.
Sermanni led the Matildas from 1994-97 and again from 2005-2012, including claiming the 2010 AFC Women's Asian Cup while bringing through the likes of Sam Kerr, Caitlin Foord and Emily van Egmond.
A women's football great, Sermanni, 67 ...

articles.title: Two inner north schools to be expanded as enrolments boom
articles.text: Two schools in Canberra's inner north will be permanently expanded to keep up with growing enrolments. An inquiry into management of ACT school infrastructure was told on Monday the Education Directorate had committed to expansions at Majura Primary School and North Ainslie Primary School in light of capacity pressures at both schools. Executive branch manager of enrolment and planning, Vanessa Attridge, said the directorate had done a roadshow through inner north schools to learn about the need ...

articles.title: Out of sight: In remote Australia, a forgotten housing crisis drags on
articles.text:
In the crowded homes of the Northern Territory's remote communities, residents are trying to keep their hopes of a better future alive.
On most afternoons in the community of Rockhole, Evelyn Andrews can be found holding court in her front yard, sat beneath the shade of a tree.
At house number 21, she shares her home with between 10 and 15 other people.
"We love it in the community, we've got the river right there and the kids are safe," she says.
"But we need some more houses."
Evelyn's communi ...

articles.title: Australia news LIVE: Ukrainian President asks Australia for military equipment to fend off Russia's invasion; Labor unveils $2.5 billion aged care plan
articles.text:
Aged care boss and former senior Liberal backs Labor's aged care plan
As regular readers of this blog will know, Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese pledged to make it compulsory for every aged care facility to have a registered nurse on site at all hours during last night's budget reply speech.
Former NSW premier and current aged care boss Mike Baird was on the ABC's RN breakfast earlier, and backed Labor's proposal.
"I think it's a good plan," he said.
"This is a pretty significant day for the  ...

articles.title: Coalition neglecting aged care crisis: Albanese
articles.text:
Challenged on why Labor has not committed to implementing all of the recommendations of the commission, which found widespread failures of care and standards, Mr Albanese said Labor's plan included an on-site nurse in every home around the clock, increased care hours, and better food and nutrition.
Labor will advocate and fund a pay increase for workers and spend another $2.5 billion to lift care standards around the country. He argues wages as low as $22 an hour are discouraging people from joi ...

articles.title: Cheeky '70s comedy joins the 'tit-for-tat' trend in TV nudity
articles.text:
A year and a half ago, when it came time to cast a particular scene in the pilot episode of Minx, showrunner Ellen Rapoport sifted through hundreds of photos of background actors that had already been sorted into piles.
"Like: small ones, big ones, crooked ones, foreskin," Rapoport recalled. "I just wanted it all." (The photos were not of the actors' faces.)
Minx, a cheeky comedy set in 1970s southern California, stars Ophelia Lovibond as Joyce, a hard-line feminist who becomes enmeshed with Dou ...

articles.title: Cyril Rioli revelations put Hawthorn president Jeff Kennett under yet more scrutiny
articles.text:
Jeff Kennett has come under increasing pressure to step down as president of AFL club Hawthorn after revelations about his treatment of Cyril Rioli and the premiership star's family.
In a report in The Age on Saturday, Rioli said he will not return to the club while Kennett remains in his post.
The four-time flag hero's stance is the result of a series of issues that Rioli said fractured the relationship between Hawthorn and its Indigenous players during his time there between 2008 and 2018.
The ...

articles.title: 'No alternative': NSW teachers to walk off job next week over pay and conditions
articles.text:
The NSW Teachers Federation has announced its members will strike next Wednesday, May 4 over pay and conditions.
The union's state executive unanimously decided to proceed with the strike at a meeting today.
They have also authorised members to walk off school grounds if a NSW government MP enters them, and have put an immediate ban on the implementation of new policies.
The federation's president Angelo Gavrielatos said there was "no alternative" but to take industrial action.
"If we don't pay  ...

articles.title: Selwood backs Pearce's AFL coaching bid
articles.text:
Geelong captain Joel Selwood has backed Daisy Pearce to one day coach a men's AFL team as the AFLW star considers multiple off-field offers.
The Cats are in the box seat to secure Pearce's services as an assistant coach for their men's program in what would be a major coup.
Pearce, the face of the AFLW since it launched in 2017, is expected to retire as a player after Melbourne's season ends.
The 33-year-old mother of twins has become a TV star with the Seven Network, and has been promoted to be ...

articles.title: It's a landlords' market as vacancy rates fall to 1pc nationally
articles.text:
Sydney's vacancy rate fell to 1.4 per cent, its lowest point since Domain records began, while Canberra and Perth posted an all-time low of 0.5 per cent.
Adelaide recorded 0.2 per cent - the lowest vacancy rate across any capital city since Domain started tracking the series. In Melbourne, the vacancy rate fell to 1.8 per cent, the lowest level since the onset of the pandemic.
Terry Ryder, director of property research firm Hotspotting, said rental markets nationwide were experiencing chronic re ...

articles.title: Winter booster shots for vulnerable Australians to begin on April 4
articles.text:
Older Australians, aged and disability care residents, Indigenous people and the immunocompromised will have first access to winter COVID-19 vaccine boosters, with fourth shots to start next month.
While the federal government has ample supply for fourth and fifth injections for the whole of the Australian population, no plans for a wider rollout have been made.
Instead the vulnerable groups will get access to injections to boost their protection against the virus from April 4, coinciding with t ...

articles.title: They 'have the X-factor': Plan to copy the success of NSW's top public high schools
articles.text:
"The transition was really hard, but the teachers were so supportive, they helped me adapt and feel a sense of belonging at Cabramatta High School," he said. "The students were so friendly."
The south-west Sydney school, where 96 per cent of students are from non-English-speaking backgrounds, is one of the final four schools to be included in the state government's Ambassador Schools program.
The program has pinpointed 10 high-achieving schools, based on NAPLAN and HSC data, with the aim of find ...

articles.title: Kennett says Hawks taking Rioli seriously
articles.text:
Kennett says Hawks taking Rioli seriouslyRoger VaughanAAPWed, 6 April 2022 5:43PM
Hawthorn president Jeff Kennett has promised they are taking Cyril Rioli's claims against the AFL club seriously, while giving no clue as to his immediate future.
In a letter to members on Wednesday, Kennett said the Hawks were trying to find out if there had been other incidents affecting past Indigenous players.
"Some will demand immediate answers and actions but, given how important these matters are, the best r ...

articles.title: Catholic schools predict 15 per cent teacher shortfall by 2030
articles.text:
Catholic schools in NSW expect a workforce shortfall of around 15 per cent by the end of the decade, driven by the retirement of baby boomer teachers and a lack of candidates willing to join the profession to replace them.
The Catholic Schools NSW submission to a federal inquiry into teacher training said the sector - like public schools - is already suffering shortages in certain locations, such as regional areas, and in subjects such as mathematics.
The NSW Catholic system runs almost 600 scho ...

articles.title: The NSW Liberal Party is experimenting with political outsiders
articles.text:
"Australians want their cost of living lowered and a fair go to improve their own lives," he said on Monday.
Whether left or right, political parties are conservative organisations. They prefer conformity, especially from elected representatives, because they're hierarchical organisations trying to impose order on chaos.
Kennedy wasn't a Young Liberal - he joined the party 18 months ago - which means the 39-year-old hasn't had time to absorb the party lore, ritual beliefs or visceral fear of pow ...

articles.title: COVID-19 cases drop in WA as fourth jab introduced for those aged 65-plus
articles.text:
Western Australia recorded 6082 new COVID-19 cases on Monday, as the state government introduced a fourth vaccination jab for vulnerable cohorts including those aged 65 and over.
The Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation approved the fourth dose for high-risk groups which also includes residents in aged care or disability facilities and Indigenous people aged 50 and above.
Those with severe immunosuppression are eligible for a fifth dose.
Health Minister Amber-Jade Sanderson encour ...

articles.title: Murder-accused cop's elite team part-time
articles.text:
Murder-accused cop's elite team part-timeAaron BunchAAPThu, 24 February 2022 12:35AM
The primary role of the elite Northern Territory police unit a murder-accused constable belonged to when he fatally shot an Aboriginal teenager was to cordon and contain offenders.
Constable Zachary Rolfe, 30, has pleaded not guilty to murdering Kumanjayi Walker during a failed arrest attempt in Yuendumu, 290km northwest of Alice Springs, late on November 9, 2019.
Rolfe shot the 19-year-old three times after the ...

articles.title: Constable Rolfe: Why I shot Kumanjayi Walker
articles.text:
Accused murderer Zachary Rolfe has told a jury how he fired fatal rounds into Indigenous man Kumanjayi Walker because he believed his police officer partner was getting stabbed and in danger of being killed.
In the officer's second day of testimony in the Northern Territory Supreme Court, the jury heard Mr Walker reached for Constable Rolfe's holstered Glock pistol during an attempt at arrest in the remote community of Yuendumu.
Moments earlier, Mr Walker had stabbed Constable Rolfe in the left  ...

articles.title: Canada to ban foreigners from buying homes as prices soar
articles.text:
Ottawa | Canada will ban most foreigners from buying homes for two years and provide billions of dollars to spur construction activity in an attempt to cool off a surging real-estate market.
The measures will be contained in Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland's budget on Thursday (Friday AEST), according to a person familiar with the matter, asking not to be named because the matter is private.
The move signals that Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is becoming more assertive about taming one of the ...

articles.title: Nine AFL clubs to employ full-time female assistant coaches in men's teams
articles.text:
At least one half of the AFL's 18 clubs will employ full-time female assistant coaches in their previously all-male coaching departments before the end of the 2022 season.
In a radical affirmative action plan hatched to redress the glaring dearth of women mentors in the AFLW, coaches and aspiring coaches such as Bec Goddard, Alicia Eva, Chloe McMillan, Erin Phillips, Daisy Pearce and Chelsea Randall will be assured full-time roles in the AFL system.
All nine women coaches will all earn at least  ...

articles.title: Aged care workers to strike for better pay
articles.text:
The aged care workforce has voted for a national strike in the middle of the federal election campaign in a push for better pay and conditions.
The May 10 strike, less than two weeks out from the election, was endorsed by union leaders from aged care providers on Wednesday night, with the United Workers Union saying members are fighting for better pay and conditions.
It's the first time the aged care work force has embarked on a national strike, with the union expressing anger at Prime Minister  ...

articles.title: How we picked the award-winners
articles.text:
The AFR BOSS Best Places to Work list is an annual list, judged by behavioural science consultancy Inventium, that ranks Australia and New Zealand's best workplaces across ten different industries: Agriculture, Mining & Utilities; Banking, Superannuation & Financial Services; Government, Education & NFP; Health Industries; Manufacturing & Consumer Goods; Media & Marketing; Professional Services; Property, Construction & Transport; Retail, Hospitality, Tourism & Entertainment; and Technology.
Ent ...

articles.title: Investigation ordered after woman dies waiting for care at Busselton hospital
articles.text:
An investigation will be launched into the death of a woman waiting for care at Busselton Health Campus on Wednesday.
The woman had been taken to the hospital in an ambulance but was inside the emergency department when she died.
WA Country Health Service chief executive Jeff Moffet said the woman was brought into the emergency department upon arrival but died on Wednesday afternoon.
"I feel deeply for the patient's family - while we will never be able to replace their loss, it's important we wo ...

articles.title: Qld woman's death treated as suspicious
articles.text:
The death of a woman in the driveway of a Cairns unit is being treated as suspicious, as a man known to her is questioned by police.
Investigators believe the man alerted emergency services at about 5am on Friday morning before the 47-year-old woman was found unconscious in the suburb of Manunda.
She died at the scene at about 6.20am.
Police are looking at whether domestic violence played a role, but Detective Inspector Kevin Goan said the investigation is still in the early stages.
"There had b ...

articles.title: Immigration and education can't fill 6.5m digital worker gap
articles.text:
To transform successfully, businesses must embrace a digital mindset.
And that means that, primarily, digital transformation is a people issue; it's a talent issue.
In fact, it's a talent challenge.
The change required for Australian businesses to fundamentally retool and digitally transform will take a big influx of new talent and skills, or a rethink of traditional labour models.
Actually, it will take both.
A recent study conducted by economics consultancy AlphaBeta and Amazon Web Services sh ...

articles.title: Demons' Birch ready for AFLW final at MCG
articles.text:
A historic AFLW game at the MCG will mean more to Melbourne defender Libby Birch than just a preliminary final.
The Demons will host the Brisbane Lions on Saturday at the 100,000-capacity stadium in what shapes as a landmark event for women's sport.
It will be the first time since the inception of the competition in 2017 that AFLW teams have played on the hallowed turf at the MCG.
Birch has long been an advocate of staging women's games in stadiums rather than solely at suburban venues.
The Demo ...

articles.title: Surprise support after anti-trans comments
articles.text:
Embattled candidate Katherine Deves backed by another minister after anti-trans commentsCourtney GouldNCA NewsWireMon, 18 April 2022 5:45AM
Assistant Treasurer Michael Sukkar has thrown his support behind embattled candidate Katherine Deves despite calls for her to be dumped over her anti-trans views.
A string of reports over the past week have brought to several inflammatory comments made by Ms Deves on social media, including one where she likened her lobbying to stop transgender athletes from ...

articles.title: Man's body found in Qld welfare check
articles.text:
The body of a 24-year-old man has been found at a house in central Queensland by police conducting a welfare check.
Officers also found a man and woman, believed to be the dead man's brother and mother, at the home in the Gladstone suburb of Glen Eden about 1pm on Sunday.
The 50-year-old woman and 20-year-old man were both taken to hospital with injuries, police said.
A crime scene has been declared and investigations are underway, but officers are not looking for anyone else in connection with  ...

articles.title: Tackling gender, class and race: Chronicle of the NGV's queer closet turns up surprises
articles.text:
"I would rather go to hell than to a homophobic heaven." If he'd said nothing else, Desmond Tutu, the Anglican Archbishop of South Africa, could be forever remembered for this bold aphorism. The Bible recommends death for male homosexuals (Leviticus 20.13) and centuries of church dogma maintained the anathema; but against this authority Tutu declared that hatred of same-sex relations was ungodly.
A picture by Sean Loughrey shows this brave leader laughing for joy after the release of Nelson Mand ...

articles.title: Perrottet to meet key independent over transgender comments
articles.text:
NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet will meet crossbench MP Alex Greenwich and transgender advocates next week after the key independent threatened to withdraw support for government supply and confidence over the premier's comments about transgender people in sport.
Perrottet this week weighed into the transgender sporting debate dominating the federal election campaign in the seat of Warringah, saying he believed "girls and women should be free to play sport against girls and women".
Greenwich, the  ...

articles.title: Labor attacks coalition aged care handling
articles.text:
Labor has backed aged care workers across the nation planning to walk off the job over low pay and under staffing.
Thousands of aged care staff in Queensland, Western Australia and South Australia have voted in favour of strike action.
Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese is in the seat of Rankin, south of Brisbane, where he told reporters Labor's five point to plan to overhaul the system included pay rises for staff, based on royal commission recommendations.
He said there was a reason the one-wo ...

articles.title: Thousands hit by delay to $400 bonus
articles.text:
More than half of aged care workers still haven't received government cash incentiveEllen RansleyNCA NewsWireThu, 7 April 2022 9:45AM
More than half of the country's aged care workers are yet to receive their first $400 cash bonus from the government, almost two months after it was first announced.
In early February, Prime Minister Scott Morrison announced eligible workers would be given two payments of $400 - the first in February, and the second at the beginning of May - to help retain staff.
 ...

articles.title: Why performing a striptease can be a feminist statement
articles.text:
Despite being nearly nude professionally for over seven years, burlesque performer Porcelain Alice is yet to do a bucks' night. "They can see from my Instagram that I do weird, vintage things. (She mimes a slow glove peel and cracks up.) 'Here comes my hand ... and a little story about feminism and why I get to take off this corset.' It's not really what they're looking for ... "
Alice is a full-time producer and performer. Along with two guests - "booty manipulator" Demon Derriere and "swing da ...

articles.title: NSW teacher strike achieves nil, minister
articles.text:
The NSW teachers' strike planned for next week will only disrupt hardworking families and students, according to the NSW education minister.
Sarah Mitchell says she's frustrated with the decision made by the NSW Teachers Federation to walk off the job for 24 hours next Wednesday.
"I'm pretty disappointed, I'm on the side of the parents here," Ms Mitchell told Sydney radio 2GB on Wednesday.
"It's frustrating, I think our kids have had a lot of disruption over the last couple of years.
"I am the m ...

articles.title: Rising house prices drive record wealth
articles.text:
Rising housing prices helped drive total household wealth to its highest level on record at $14.7 trillion in 2021.
Australian Bureau of Statistics figures show wealth increased by 4.5 per cent or $628 billion in the December quarter, while wealth per capita now stands at a record high of $566,541.
ABS head of finance and wealth Katherine Keenan said residential property prices rose 4.7 per cent during the quarter, reflecting record low interest rates, the labour market recovery and strong deman ...

articles.title: Woman and two young children found dead in burnt-out vehicle at Perth car park, police reveal
articles.text:
The bodies of a woman aged in her 40s and two young children were found in a burnt-out car in Coogee in Perth's southern suburbs yesterday, police have revealed.
WA Police said the woman and children, an eight-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl, were believed to be from the same family.
The bodies were found in the vehicle in a car park at John Graham Reserve.
Major Crime Division Detective Inspector Quentin Flatman said it did not appear there was any third party involved in the deaths.
He sai ...

articles.title: Monday start for winter booster rollout
articles.text:
Monday start for winter booster rolloutStaff WritersAAPSun, 3 April 2022 7:24AM
While more than 30 per cent of Australians eligible to have their third COVID-19 shot are yet to, the elderly and vulnerable will begin receiving a second booster ahead of a predicted winter infection surge from Monday.
The groups will include those 65 or older, Indigenous Australians aged at least 50, disability care residents and the immunocompromised.
An estimated 4.7 million people will be eligible to get the fou ...

articles.title: Doubling cybersecurity corps will require a 'revolution' in workforce planning
articles.text:
"There's nobody actually to do those jobs," Mr Munson said. "The only way they're going to attract people to do those jobs is by taking them from other government departments or other Australian companies."
Aside from the existing technology skills shortages, the lengthy security screening process required to work for the cybersecurity intelligence agency may deter some candidates.
Tuesday's budget included nearly $10 billion to expand the capabilities of the ASD, including the creation of extra ...

articles.title: Job security or slightly higher pay? It's a tough choice for aged care workers
articles.text:
Terri Campbell quit her job in the care sector after just four months.
The worker-starved industry would have no doubt benefited from her years of experience, but she wanted job security in return.
Yet the role she took on at a home-based care provider in Esperance in 2020 offered no clear pathway from her casual contract to a permanent part-time position.
"I [was] looking down the barrel of getting married and wanting to get loans and things organised," Ms Campbell said.
"When you're trying to  ...

articles.title: Teacher want a pay rise, but won't go on strike - yet
articles.text:
The NSW teachers union has vowed to continue its campaign for higher pay but will defer any more strike action until term two, saying schooling has already been too disrupted by COVID-19.
The NSW Teachers Federation wants the NSW government to breach its public sector wage cap and give teachers a rise of between five and 7.5 per cent, plus two extra hours of planning time per week.
Teachers held a strike last November, and have vowed to continue industrial action. The matter is in the Industrial ...

articles.title: Minx: feminist idealism is tested in this romp through 1970s LA
articles.text:
The television streaming industry is not unlike the magazine scene of the 1970s, says veteran Hollywood producer, Paul Feig, creator of 1990s cult classic Freaks and Geeks, whose directing credits include Nurse Jackie and 30 Rock. Just as the earnest magazine editor in his new series Minx discovers while trying to pitch her radical title The Matriarchy Awakens, competition is stiff in a brave new world saturated with big ideas.
"The magazine industry in the 1970s was the big thing, and everyone  ...

articles.title: End 'culture war' on trans issues, MP says, as both sides threatened
articles.text:
Independent NSW MP Alex Greenwich has called for an end to the "culture war" over transgender women's participation in sport, as both sides of the political debate claim they have been threatened with violence and referred the allegations to police.
The national peak body for LGBTQ+ health and wellbeing has warned the public conversation sparked by controversial comments from Liberal Party Warringah candidate Katherine Deves is harming transgender and gender-diverse people, particularly trans wo ...

articles.title: Queensland flood recovery will take 'months and years' as housing crisis looms for affected residents
articles.text:
The newly appointed coordinator of Queensland's flood recovery effort is warning the disaster will take a long time to get over.
"This is not a days and weeks [operation], this is months and years," Major General Jake Ellwood told ABC's 7.30.
"Multiple tasks need to be done over 22 local government areas -- it is massive."
Making sure people can safely access their properties remains an immediate priority.
"But at the same time, making sure we understand the needs of every area independently, th ...

articles.title: Fourth 'winter' COVID vaccine recommended for people over 65
articles.text:
Older Australians and people at the highest risk of severe disease will be able to get a fourth coronavirus vaccine ahead of winter and an expected surge in COVID-19 and flu cases.
The Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation announced the recommendation for an additional "winter" booster dose of a COVID-19 vaccine on Friday to increase protection for people aged over 65 and other vulnerable groups, as foreshadowed by the Herald and The Age earlier this week.
More than five million pe ...

articles.title: Tech sector urges immigration policy changes
articles.text:
"It feels like it has been a perfect storm of closed borders and huge competition for talent from larger US tech businesses such as Salesforce, Oracle, as well as local tech giants like Atlassian and Canva. My boss is starting to wonder what the hell I am doing down here, and based on the conversations I've had with other local MDs, this is an industry-wide crisis"
Mr Tyrrell said Labor's plans involving extra training at TAFE and universities were a potential long-term solution, but did not cre ...

articles.title: Labor pledges $2.5b for aged care pay rises and better standards
articles.text:
He said for too long, many operators had put profit before care.
With wages as low as $22 an hour discouraging people from joining a sector already battling a labour shortage, Mr Albanese said Labor, if elected, would make a submission to a current union case before the Fair Work Commission to increase pay as part of a proposed overhaul of the aged care workers award.
The promise applies to federally subsidised aged care homes and if the wage rise was granted, the Labor government would pick up  ...

articles.title: Murder-accused NT cop 'ignored training'
articles.text:
Murder-accused NT cop 'ignored training'Aaron BunchAAPTue, 1 March 2022 12:33AM
A murder-accused policeman should not have rushed into a house where he fatally shot an Aboriginal teenager during a failed outback arrest, a jury has heard.
Constable Zachary Rolfe, 30, has pleaded not guilty to murdering Kumanjayi Walker, 19, after the teen stabbed him in the shoulder with a pair of scissors on November 9, 2019.
Rolfe fired three shots into Mr Walker as he resisted arrest in a room at his grandmoth ...

articles.title: Wounds, jeers and mystery notes: Medics take stand in outback cop murder trial
articles.text:
The Aboriginal teenager killed in a police shooting in the remote Northern Territory desert had anatomical use of his right arm - which held a 10-centimetre pair of scissors - when Constable Zachary Rolfe made the decision to fire a second round from point-blank range, a court has heard.
Dr Keith Towsey, a Queensland-based trauma surgeon with medic experience in the Defence forces, said it was this second shot that ended Kumanjayi Walker's life.
The officer, now 30, shot Mr Walker three times -  ...

articles.title: 'Take a bit of a risk': Cricket skipper Lanning backs bold moves for women's sport
articles.text:
Australian cricket captain Meg Lanning has encouraged sporting bodies to invest resources, time and energy into female tournaments and competitions after a world record crowd of 91,553 for a women's sporting event attended a soccer match at Camp Nou in Barcelona this week.
Just days away from leading Australia into the ODI World Cup final against England in Christchurch, Lanning joined those urging football fans to show up in numbers for Saturday's historic AFLW preliminary final between Melbour ...

articles.title: 'It was just one of those moments in Australian history'
articles.text:
If there are two sides to every story, untangling these perspectives is the often unenviable task faced by a journalist, as it was for Brisbane Times reporter Zach Hope, who followed the Darwin trial of Constable Zach Rolfe over the killing of Indigenous man Kumanjayi Walker.
Hope joins us on an episode of Good Weekend Talks to discuss his magazine cover story - BROKEN HEART - about the death of a 19-year-old from Yuendumu at the hands of an Alice Springs policeman.
On one side of that story is  ...

articles.title: Aged care pay rise case set to begin
articles.text:
A push to increase aged care worker wages will move into the spotlight when hearings begin in the Fair Work Commission.
The case by the Health Services Union, which begins on Tuesday, will seek to lift wages for workers in the sector by 25 per cent.
It comes as support for aged care has emerged as a key issue for both parties in the federal election.
The union's national president Gerard Hayes said the commission case would seek to cover personal care staff, along with caterers, cleaners, admini ...

articles.title: Bunnings used to expose big pay issue
articles.text:
Aged care workers are seriously underpaid when compared to Bunnings employees or traffic controllers who "twist signs on a road", a major wage case has been told.
The Fair Work Commission, which is the independent wage umpire that sets the minimum rates for different industries, began its first day of hearings on Tuesday to decide whether aged care workers should get a 25 per cent pay rise.
Entry-level personal care workers can earn as little as $21.96 per hour, but the Health Services Union, wh ...

articles.title: Value of Australia's housing market swells
articles.text:
The value of Australia's housing market now stands at close to $10 trillion after growing at the fastest annual pace in at least 18 years during 2021.
The Australian Bureau of Statistics said residential property prices rose 23.7 per cent through 2021, the strongest annual growth since its records began in the September quarter of 2003.
It said the value of residential dwellings has risen by just over $2 trillion since the December quarter 2020.
In the December quarter of last year, the mean pri ...

articles.title: Police find two bodies with gunshot wounds
articles.text:
Two bodies with gunshot wounds have been found by police inside a home on Monday night.
Police were called to a home on Teal Street in Caloundra West just before 6.30pm to check on the welfare of the woman who lives at the property on the Sunshine Coast.
They found the woman's body and also that of a man, with indications both died from gunshot wounds.
Although the woman was not formally identified, police believe she was 48, while the man, from Browns Plains south of Brisbane, was 52.
Police ha ...

articles.title: BRS 'mentored' NT police shooter
articles.text:
Beleaguered ex-SAS soldier Ben Roberts-Smith acted as a "mentor" to Northern Territory cop Zachary Rolfe, who was put on trial for the shooting death of an Indigenous man in 2019, court documents have revealed.
Mr Rolfe, 30, was today found not guilty of murder and other charges in the shooting death of 19-year-old Kumanjayi Walker in 2019.
Mr Walker was shot three times by Mr Rolfe in the course of an attempted arrest in a remote community. He died at a local medical clinic roughly an hour late ...

articles.title: 'Sometimes enough is enough': Chris Johnson backs Cyril Rioli's stance over Jeff Kennett
articles.text:
Chris Johnson, a member of the AFL's Indigenous Team of the Century, has backed Cyril Rioli's decision to cut ties with Hawthorn while Jeff Kennett remains club president, saying he and his wife have every right to feel the way they do.
In a report in The Age on Saturday, Rioli said he would not return to the club in any capacity while Kennett remained in his post.
The four-time premiership winner said a series of issues had fractured the relationship between Hawthorn and its Indigenous players  ...

articles.title: They've been described as 'meaningless league tables'. And this new NAPLAN data hopes to end them
articles.text:
For the first time since the start of the pandemic, parents will have fresh and relevant NAPLAN data on the My School website to compare their school's performance.
The Australian Curriculum Assessment and Reporting Authority (ACARA), which administers the literacy and numeracy test, said parents could now contrast their school with others of a similar socio-economic profile.
Previously the comparisons were much broader with schools in low-income areas ranked alongside wealthy, established power ...

articles.title: Almost half of NSW's year 1 students do not read as well as they should
articles.text:
More than 40 per cent of year 1 students do not read as well as they should and the problem is most acute among disadvantaged children, with two in three failing to meet the expected standard in the first statewide NSW phonics check.
But the results of the check - held in public schools after a term of remote learning - were an improvement on a trial the year before, in which almost one in six students did not reach the expected achievement level of 28 correct answers from 40 questions.
Educatio ...

articles.title: 'Senseless violence': Pensioner found dead
articles.text:
Queensland police have established a crime scene after an elderly woman was found dead in a house on the Gold Coast.
Police were called to the Molendinar property, located north of the Gold Coast, around 8.40pm on Sunday night.
They discovered the body of a 74-year-old pensioner with significant injuries.
A 50-year-old man, who is known to the woman, is assisting police with their investigation.
The "sudden death" is not believed to be domestic violence-related.
Tributes flowed on social media f ...

articles.title: Latest health advice on COVID-19 pandemic
articles.text:
* Top health advisers have given the green light to a fourth vaccine jab for certain groups.
* Adults aged 65 and over, Indigenous Australians 50 years or over, aged care and disability residents, and people aged 16 years and older who are severely immunocompromised will be eligible.
* The program will start on April 4 through pharmacies, general practices, state and Commonwealth clinics and Indigenous medical clinics.
* It is recommended the fourth jab be received four to six months after the t ...

articles.title: Misadventure believed to be the cause of Bondi Beach woman's death
articles.text:
Investigators believe that a woman whose body was found in a Bondi Beach apartment on Thursday died as a result of misadventure.
While still awaiting the results of an autopsy to be performed on Friday, detectives probing the death of the 38-year-old initially considered domestic violence as a factor in her death, but now believe it was not suspicious.
Police spoke to the woman's partner at length on Thursday, after NSW ambulance attended the O'Brien Street apartment they shared and found her un ...

articles.title: NT cop's first shot not fatal: pathologist
articles.text:
Kumanjayi Walker would not have died from Constable Zachary Rolfe first shot, a forensic pathologist has told a jury.
Rolfe shot the Aboriginal teenager three times during a failed arrest attempt in Yuendumu, 290km northwest of Alice Springs, on November 9, 2019.
The 19-year-old died on the floor of the local police station 74 minutes after the second fatal shot ripped through the teen's spleen, liver, left kidney and right lung.
The constable has pleaded not guilty to murder, saying he was doin ...

articles.title: Woman's body found in Bondi home
articles.text:
'Severe facial injuries': Man being questioned by police after woman's body found at Bondi unitAlex DruceNCA NewsWireThu, 31 March 2022 9:05AM
A woman's death is being treated as suspicious after her body was found in a Bondi apartment with 'severe facial injuries' early on Thursday.
NSW Police said a man is assisting them with inquires after the body of a 38-year-old woman was discovered at a unit block on O'Brien Street at about 5am.
The man is known to the woman and is speaking with investiga ...

articles.title: They 'have the X-factor': Plan to copy the success of NSW's top public schools
articles.text:
"The transition was really hard, but the teachers were so supportive, they helped me adapt and feel a sense of belonging at Cabramatta High School," he said. "The students were so friendly."
The south-west Sydney school, where 96 per cent of students are from non-English-speaking backgrounds, is one of the final four schools to be included in the state government's Ambassador Schools program.
The program has pinpointed 10 high-achieving schools, based on NAPLAN and HSC data, with the aim of find ...

articles.title: Murder-accused NT cop 'ignored training'
articles.text:
A murder-accused policeman should not have rushed into a house where he fatally shot an Aboriginal teenager during a failed outback arrest, a jury has heard.
Constable Zachary Rolfe, 30, has pleaded not guilty to murdering Kumanjayi Walker, 19, after the teen stabbed him in the shoulder with a pair of scissors on November 9, 2019.
Rolfe fired three shots into Mr Walker as he resisted arrest in a room at his grandmother's home in Yuendumu, 290km northwest of Alice Springs.

articles.title: This mean girls franchise will just run and run
articles.text:
"Naah. Not sexy enough. We need to appeal to the male teenage demographic. Maybe something a bit more..."
"Hoo-WAH!! I got one, bro! You want sexy? How about 'Mean Girls 3. The Grown-Up Years'. You thought those girls were mean at high school... wait 'til ya see 'em now!"
Lengthy pause. Surreptitious glances.
(Tentatively): "You know. I kinda like that idea... The original Mean Girls movie pulled in a cool hundred and thirty million from a tiny budget! Plus the sequel did really well. There was  ...

articles.title: Aged care pay rise not in federal budget
articles.text:
A pay rise for aged care workers has not been budgeted for this year, a federal minister has confirmed.
Government Services Minister Linda Reynolds says the coalition government will review any decisions by the independent regulator before committing to a pay rise for aged care workers.
"(The government) will wait for (the Fair Work Commission) to do their work, they'll make a determination, we will review it and then we will take whatever position we do after that review," she told a Senate est ...

articles.title: Labor unveils 1.2m tech job election pledge
articles.text:
Industry group the Tech Council of Australia has previously forecast the Australian workforce is 260,000 workers short of what will be needed by 2025, with the founders of leading local companies Atlassian, Canva and Afterpay heading to Canberra late last year to sign a partnership with the federally funded Digital Skills Organisation to try to solve the problem.
Some details of Labor's policy need to be further fleshed out, but a draft plan seen by The Australian Financial Review said tech is c ...

articles.title: Over 1100 WA COVID cases missed in reporting blunder
articles.text:
Catholic Education WA has become entangled in a COVID reporting bungle, as the State records 6892 new COVID cases.
Premier Mark McGowan said there were 1100 additional cases - not included in today's numbers - that dated back to March 11 as rapid antigen tests collected by Catholic Education WA had not been reported.
Mr McGowan said the Christian organisation had discovered the "error" and alerted authorities.
He said they would be added to the total COVID numbers, but were not part of WA's case ...

articles.title: The murder trial you should know about
articles.text:
Space to play or pause, M to mute, left and right arrows to seek, up and down arrows for volume.
Three years ago, during an attempted arrest in a remote Northern Territory community, Aboriginal teenager Kumanjayi Walker was shot and killed.
In a first since the Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody thirty years ago, the police officer who shot him is on trial for murder.
Policeman Zachary Rolfe, who has pleaded not guilty to murder and lesser charges, finally took the stand on Wedne ...

articles.title: Siti is learning Aussie rules footy in Indonesia and would like to play the game in Australia
articles.text:
After watching a recorded Australian Rules football game on television from her home in Indonesia, Siti Nurbaeti became curious about the sport.
"The shape of the ball is not even round, it would ... make an odd bounce," Ms Nurbaeti said.
She also thought Aussie rules footy looked "very tough", so was worried when a friend asked her to join an AFL training clinic in Central Java.
The 19-year-old student is one of an increasing number of women in Indonesia picking up a footy not only to get fit b ...

articles.title: Developers say Victoria social housing tax will hit first home buyers
articles.text:
But the argument drew a rebuke from planning consultants and economists, who said the tax would instead push down land values.
"They are in no position to say 'We've got this levy, we'll pass it on'," said Marcus Spiller, a principal of consultancy SGS Economics and Planning.
"When they're doing feasibility study, they look at what price they can get on the finished lots. They take out the costs, take out their profit margin, take out tax and are left with the residual land value. The residual l ...

articles.title: NSW teachers to strike over bitter pay row
articles.text:
NSW teachers will strike for 24 hours next week to protest pay and working conditions - joining other public sector workers demanding an increase to a state government-imposed salary cap.
The NSW Teachers Federation state executive made the decision to strike on May 4 during a meeting on Tuesday morning after polling members and returning a unanimous vote from the executive.
They have also authorised union members to walk off school grounds during state government MP visits - the first time in a ...

articles.title: O'Meara hopes Hawks, Riolis can heal rift
articles.text:
O'Meara hopes Hawks, Riolis can heal riftRoger VaughanAAPTue, 5 April 2022 12:17PM
Acting captain Jaeger O'Meara hopes Hawthorn can repair their relationship with retired star Cyril Rioli, saying they have made "strong grounds" on Indigenous issues.
Rioli and his wife Shannyn Ah Sam-Rioli are estranged from the club, with the Norm Smith Medallist and four-time premiership player saying he will not be involved there while Jeff Kennett remains president.
It is the result of issues Rioli said fract ...

articles.title: Hello UX designers, agile coaches: ABS tracks new jobs
articles.text:
The structural shortage of people trained with digital skills has been cited as the biggest handbrake on the growth of the local information technology sector and more widely across the economy as company leaders find themselves having to bid up wages to secure the services of an increasingly scarce pool of qualified IT workers.
The current list of 1070 occupations is "heavily based on the 2001 population census" and now out of step with the types of jobs that Australians are increasingly carryi ...

articles.title: Women's sport to continue to take centre stage at News Corp
articles.text:
It's less than a year since News Corp launched its new women's sport strategy, and a commitment to deliver unprecedented coverage of women's sport across its platforms.
Today on International Women's Day, News Corp celebrates and thanks all involved -- including athletes such as Ash Barty, Jess Fox and Ellyse Perry -- who have helped us address the under representation of women's sport through increased editorial coverage.
Stream Over 50 Sports Live & On-Demand with Kayo. New to Kayo? Try 14-Day ...

articles.title: Winter booster rollout set for small start
articles.text:
Winter booster rollout set for small startAndrew BrownAAPSat, 2 April 2022 12:35AM
Less than five per cent of people eligible to receive a winter booster shot will be able to get the fourth dose when the rollout begins next week.
From Monday, older and vulnerable Australians will be able to receive a second COVID-19 booster, ahead of a predicted surge of infections during the upcoming winter.
The groups will include those over 65, Indigenous Australians over 50, those in aged and disability care ...

articles.title: Volunteers offer helping hand to residents in isolation
articles.text:
Shire of West Arthur volunteers lend a helping hand to residents isolating due to COVID-19Isabel VieiraNarrogin ObserverThu, 14 April 2022 2:09AMEmail Isabel Vieira
Volunteers in the Shire of West Arthur are lending a helping hand to residents isolating due to COVID-19 by running errands and completing chores.
The group of local residents, organised through the shire, are offering assistance to people isolating due to having contracted COVID-19 or being a close contact on an infectious person.
T ...

articles.title: Aboriginal teen's inquest to seek 'truth'
articles.text:
Aboriginal teen's inquest to seek 'truth'Aaron BunchAAPTue, 29 March 2022 12:19PM
A coroner says she wants to understand why police shot an Aboriginal teenager, three weeks after a court cleared the Northern Territory officer who killed him of any wrongdoing.
Kumanjayi Walker, 19, was shot three times in November 2019 as he resisted being handcuffed in Yuendumu, northwest of Alice Springs.
Magistrate Elisabeth Armitage says the inquest cannot undo the past but will give the teen's family and com ...

articles.title: Another south-west Victorian council drops home support aged care services
articles.text:
Hepburn Shire Council has voted to not continue providing aged care home support services.
At a council meeting on Tuesday, councillors voted in-principle to stop providing assistance services like home cleaning and showering to clients in the community.
In the meeting agenda, the council said "significant Commonwealth reforms" had been implemented in the past decade and the changes meant the council would not be suited to continuing as a provider.
In-session councillor Lesley Hewitt said the ch ...

articles.title: Inside Riverside Grammar: The 'school for open minds' that's run unregistered for a decade
articles.text:
On the wall of Riverside Grammar, on the banks of the Yarra River in Melbourne's eastern suburbs, hangs a poster with a Mark Twain quote: "I don't let schooling get in the way of my education."
With only seven students, a comfort dog and no government funding, this secondary school for children struggling in the mainstream system is a bit different.
But Riverside Grammar is an outlier in another way: it's the state's first unregistered school in more than a decade, and has been operating without ...

articles.title: Fix training to fix skill shortages, says AI Group
articles.text:
The handbrake on productivity from skill shortages can only be alleviated by more flexible approaches to training and education, says Australia's largest employers' group.
Adding to the list of evidence that skill shortages are set to stymie a full return to economic growth, a new survey from Ai Group found that one-third of business leaders expect they will constrain their company's growth during the next 12 months.
The CEO Business Prospects survey found that 28 per cent of chief executives ci ...

articles.title: New study into unpaid carers' leave
articles.text:
New study into unpaid carers' leaveColin BrinsdenAAPWed, 23 February 2022 7:37AM
The Morrison government has directed the Productivity Commission to undertake an inquiry into the potential impact of providing all employees unpaid carers' leave when caring for senior Australians living at home.
The study will also examine employment models across the aged care sector.
The inquiry is in response to recommendations made by the royal commission into aged care quality and safety in its final report.
 ...

articles.title: Queensland woman attacked with hammer, saw
articles.text:
Queensland woman attacked with hammer, sawLaine ClarkAAPSun, 20 February 2022 9:38AM
A man has been charged with attempted murder after a woman locked herself in a bathroom overnight to escape an alleged hammer and saw attack in Brisbane's south.
Police say officers found a seriously injured woman in her 30s with multiple head and body wounds when they were called out to a Doolandella house about 8.30am on Saturday.
They allege a 43-year-old man attacked the woman with the hammer and saw on Frid ...

articles.title: Sydney penalised for ALM bench rule breach
articles.text:
Sydney FC have received a hit to their A-League Men goal difference and a $5000 fine after being found to have broken league regulations.
The Australian Professional Leagues (APL) issued Sydney with a show cause notice regarding the make-up of its substitutes bench for three games in February and March, specifically for not having enough players below a certain age.
Teams are allowed to have seven players on the bench but under the "U23 rule" but to do so, at least three must be eligible to play ...
